text.0: yea through the power of your sweet juice ye holy the marut host is glad at sacrifices.
text.1: they cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble they make the spring flow when they come the mighty.
text.2: the maruts watch the man who sings their praises promoters of the thought of him who worships.
text.3: seat you on sacred grass in our assembly this day with friendly minds to share the banquet.
text.4: no others gleam so brightly as these maruts with their own forms their golden gauds their weapons.
text.5: with all adornments decking earth and heaven they heighten for bright show their common splendour.
text.6: far from us be your blazing dart o maruts when we through human frailty sin against you.
text.7: let us not he exposed to that ye holy may your most loving favour still attend us.
text.8: may even what we have done delight the maruts the blameless ones the bright the purifying.
text.9: further us o ye holy with your kindness advance us mightily that we may prosper.
text.10: and may the maruts praised by all their titles heroes enjoy the taste of our oblations.
text.11: give us of amṛta for the sake of offspring awake the excellent fair stores of riches.
text.12: hither ye maruts praised with all your succours with all felicity come to our princes.
text.13: who of themselves a hundredfold increase us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
